title: How to apply

headings.text: On this page you find the information necessary to apply to become an exchange student at ITU

paragraphs: Application deadlinesAutumn semester - end of August to Januar Nomination deadline: 15 April Application deadline: 1 May Spring semester - end of January to June Nomination deadline: 15 October Application deadline: 1 November Summer University - July to August Nomination deadline: 1 April Application deadline: 15 April You have to prepare the following application documents for your exchange application:
Autumn semester - end of August to Januar
Nomination deadline: 15 April Application deadline: 1 May
Spring semester - end of January to June
Nomination deadline: 15 October Application deadline: 1 November
Summer University - July to August
Nomination deadline: 1 April Application deadline: 15 April
How to meet and document the English language proficiency requirement:

This page is printed from https://www.itu.dk/uddannelser/bacheloruddannelser/global-business-informatics?utm_source=&utm_medium=paid&utm_campaign=202509__B-GBI__Kerne____meta&fbclid=IwZXh0bgNhZW0BMABhZGlkAasegyQlZ5FzcnRjBmFwcF9pZAo2NjI4NTY4Mzc5AAEe_dwgjA8FUxFxoBQry7890EXwfkrmCSf7zwNd_ePKoXkDuWza0Sa-HOncGh0_aem_SeCqDRtX5LaZ_lnr5O11qA&utm_id=120223363264680289&utm_content=120223363264750289&utm_term=120223363264670289
ITU pre-approval of credit transfer
Online Learning Agreement (for Erasmus+ students only)
Transcript of records (incl. BSc diploma if you apply for MSc courses)
Documentation for English language proficiency
Scan of passport (photo page)
Your home university sends us your nomination (we need your name, email address, date of birth (dd-mm-yyyy), gender, citizenship and level of studies: BSc/MSc)
We start up your application in our application portal and guide you on how to apply via the system
You apply within the application deadline
We confirm your application
You receive a Letter of Acceptance including information about the Introduction Day, course registration, housing and residence permit (for non EU-citizens)
We inform you about result of your course selection
You receive a welcoming email with information about your study start
Finally we welcome you on the Introduction Day at ITU
You hold an upper secondary school certificate or a BSc degree that has been fully taught in English from USA, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, England, Scotland or Ireland
You are enrolled in BSc or MSc degree fully taught in English
You are a native speaker of English
For ERASMUS students only: You have achieved the minimum result of B2 in the Online Linguistic Support (OLS)

You have achieved the minimum result in one of the following English language proficiency tests: IELTS Academic Test: minimum result of 6.5 TOEFL iBT: minimum result of 88 Cambridge Certificate of Advanced English (CAE): passed Cambridge Certificate of Proficiency in English (CPE): passed NB: The test result cannot be more than 2 years old (please note, time limitation does not apply to CPE and CAE).
IELTS Academic Test: minimum result of 6.5
TOEFL iBT: minimum result of 88
Cambridge Certificate of Advanced English (CAE): passed
Cambridge Certificate of Proficiency in English (CPE): passed
NB: The test result cannot be more than 2 years old (please note, time limitation does not apply to CPE and CAE).
